title: torch.max does not reduce correctly dimension of size 1
body_html:
Hi, on recent release 0.2, this code

import torch
a = torch.LongTensor(5, 2)
print(a.size(), a.max(0, keepdim=False)[0].size())
b = torch.LongTensor(1, 2)
print(b.size(), b.max(0, keepdim=False)[0].size())

prints this

torch.Size([5, 2]) torch.Size([2])
torch.Size([1, 2]) torch.Size([1, 2])

Is it the expected behavior or a bug? Should the last statement be torch.Size([2])?
torch.min behaves the same way; torch.sum is different and eliminates the dimension

body:
Hi, on recent release 0.2, this code
```
import torch
a = torch.LongTensor(5, 2)
print(a.size(), a.max(0, keepdim=False)[0].size())
b = torch.LongTensor(1, 2)
print(b.size(), b.max(0, keepdim=False)[0].size())
```
prints this
```
torch.Size([5, 2]) torch.Size([2])
torch.Size([1, 2]) torch.Size([1, 2])
```
Is it the expected behavior or a bug? Should the last statement be `torch.Size([2])`?
torch.min behaves the same way; torch.sum is different and eliminates the dimension
